metadata.title: CVE-2018-20762 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
GPAC version 0.7.1 and earlier has a buffer overflow vulnerability in thecat_multiple_files function in applications/mp4box/fileimport.c when MP4Boxis used for a local directory containing crafted filenames.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20762` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5
gpac-modules-base - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5
libgpac4 - 0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpac package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.5.2-426-gc5ad4e4+dfsg5-5').
